metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12376 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 61 and Firefox ESR 60.1. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort that some of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 62, Firefox ESR < 60.2, and Thunderbird < 60.2.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-12376` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 62.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 62.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 62.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '62.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
